definition: a sudden drop from an upright position, reduce the pressure of wind on (a sail)
details:
noun
- a sudden drop from an upright position
= example: a sudden drop from an upright position
= synonyms: fall
- the act of allowing a fluid to escape
= synonyms: release, spillage
- a channel that carries excess water over or around a dam or other obstruction
= synonyms: spillway, wasteweir
- liquid that is spilled
= example: liquid that is spilled
verb
- reduce the pressure of wind on (a sail)
- reveal information
= synonyms: talk
- cause or allow (a solid substance) to flow or run out or over
= example: cause or allow (a solid substance) to flow or run out or over
= synonyms: shed, disgorge
- pour out in drops or small quantities or as if in drops or small quantities
= synonyms: shed, pour forth
- cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container
= example: cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container
= synonyms: slop
- flow, run or fall out and become lost
= example: flow, run or fall out and become lost
= synonyms: run out
